page.title: 05 THE HANAU BRIDGE
page.content: The river Darent has been running through Dartford for many years. It has however only been running under the Hanau bridge for the last five years, because the bridge was only built in 1980. It is a very attractive bridge compared to the little stone bridge that was there. When the bridge was completed a new stock of fresh water fish (trout) were released into the river, but sadly they have slowly disappeared. This is probably due to the fact that it is now a very popular fishing spot and the pollution in the river. The river has also now become a popular home for many ducks and swans, and a local canoeing club use the river early morning before school. The Hanau bridge was designed and constructed by Dr.Stuart Cox, A.D.W.Smith, Mrs Eva May and S.W.Taylor.
